dhp221:1: Give up anger, get rid of conceit,
dhp221:3: Sufferings don’t befall one who has nothing,
dhp221:4: not clinging to name and form.
dhp222:1: When anger surges like a lurching chariot,
dhp222:3: That’s what I call a charioteer;
dhp224:1: Speak the truth, do not be angry,
dhp224:2: and give when asked, if only a little.
dhp224:4: you may enter the presence of the gods.
dhp226:4: their defilements come to an end.
dhp227:3: They blame you when you’re silent,
dhp227:4: they blame you when you speak a lot,
dhp227:5: and even when you speak just right:
dhp227:6: no-one in the world escapes blame.
dhp228:1: There never was, nor will be,
dhp229:1: If, after watching them day in day out,
dhp230:1: like a pendant of river gold,
dhp230:2: who is worthy to criticize them?

dhp234:1: A sage is restrained in body
dhp234:3: in thought, too, they are restrained:
dhp234:4: they are restrained in every way.
